description_long: Synthesis of ammonia (NH₃) from hydrogen (H₂) and nitrogen (N₂), where the latter is obtained from ambient air via an air-separation unit.
Steam-methane reforming of natural gas plus Haber-Bosch synthesis
Continuous casting of liquid steel into steel slabs
Hot rolling of steel of cast steel into hot-rolled coils (HRCs)
Capturing CO2 directly from ambient air, making it available as a purified gas for sequestration or utilisation.
A furnace/shaft to directly reduce iron ore into DRI/HBI.
An electric-arc furnace, which uses electricity directly to create temperature sufficiently high to melt iron and other components into liquid steel.
Water ELH2, which yields hydrogen and oxygen.
Integrated steel mill with a blast furnace and basic oxygen furnace, equipped with CCS.
Industrial heat pumps providing heat at a temperature of 80–120°C.
Industrial plants combining H₂ and CO₂ to yield methane (Sabatier process).
Synthesis of methanol from H₂ and CO₂.
Integrated steam-methane reforming and synthesis of methanol.
Synthesis of ethylene, propylene, and by-products from methanol.
Stand-alone synthesis of urea from NH₃ and CO₂ (w/o SMR-based ammonia plant).
